Electoral ink, indelible ink, electoral stain or phosphoric ink is a semi-permanent 
ink or dye that is applied to the forefinger (usually) of voters during elections in 
order to prevent electoral fraud such as double voting. It is an effective method for 
countries where identification documents for ... Ink is normally applied to the left 
hand index finger, especially to the cuticle...
